com.acrolinx.javasdk.gui.sessions.impl

Interface MarkingNavigator

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    OffsetMarkingNavigator

    public interface MarkingNavigator
    A MarkingNavigator is used by Acrolinx Java SDK to navigate through the markings. This factory provides an offset base marking navigator and a null MarkingNavigator if your integration should not be able to step through the markings. In case your application having a non-offset base document structure, you have to implement the MarkingNavigator your self. In lucky case you are developing an offset based integration an offset base MarkingNavigator is provided by GuiFactory.markingNavigators().

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static class  MarkingNavigator.Direction
      The enum Direction declares the direction in which the flags are visited.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static MarkingNavigator NULL
      The NULL MarkingNavigator could be used if the integration should not be able to navigate through the markings.

    • Field Detail

      • NULL

        static final MarkingNavigator NULL
        The NULL MarkingNavigator could be used if the integration should not be able to navigate through the markings.

    • Method Detail

      • getKeyFromCursor

        Key getKeyFromCursor(MarkingNavigator.Direction direction)
        Gets the key from cursor.
        Parameters:
        direction - the direction
        Returns:
        This method should return the next or previous marking (depending on the given MarkingNavigator.Direction) near to the current cursor position.
        Note: You must implement a wrap around for the first or last marking in your document.

      • getKey

        Key getKey(Key key,
         MarkingNavigator.Direction direction)
        Gets the key.
        Parameters:
        key - the key
        direction - the direction
        Returns:
        This method should return the next or previous marking (depending on the given MarkingNavigator.Direction) near to the given Key.
        Note: You must implement a wrap around for the first or last marking in your document.
